result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rachel F. Gerber

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Victim makes statement.

COURT ORDERS:  
14CF889
Ct 1. (Forgery-Uttering/PTAC/Repeater) >> 6 years WSPS, 3 years IC & 3 years ES; concurrent to sentence currently being served and to 14CM1764. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow up;  A/T/C as deemed appropriate. LEEP parenting class; GFE to maintain full time work/school and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours CS per week; eligible for programming; court costs, DNA sample and surcharge if not done so already. COURT 202 days jail credit

14CM1764
Ct 1. (BJ/Repeater) >> 2 years WSPS, 1 year IC & 1 year ES; concurrent to sentence currently being served and to 14CF889. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow up;  A/T/C as deemed appropriate. LEEP parenting class; GFE full time work/school and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours CS per week; eligible for programming; court costs, DNA sample and surcharge if not done so already. COURT 202 days jail credit

Rothschild Officer Darrin Honkanen sworn & testifies. Arguments. Crt finds probable cause & binds defendant over for trial. State moves for 30 days to file Information - crt grants. Bond to Continue.
